posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
So the new patch has now gone live.

Among other things (groovy man), it allows up to 8 Classes to build with.  My question is, how does the ECB wish to respond to this?

Granted, it is a 2da change (done in rules.2da) - meaning that it will have to be consciously changed from the standard 3.  In SP, not a problem, just open it, change it, drop it in the override, bam!

Online is not so simple, as only those with access to the Mod itself can do this, meaning they decide what is what.

Perhaps we need a new building section for this?  I mean, it is going to blow Building to smithereens!  So.Many.Possibilities!

posts.author: Dingpot
posts.content:
Would you be kind enough to provide expanded instructions for tech dummies on how to open it, change it and drop it in the override. I may not do so just yet, having enough trouble with 3 classes but might be useful to know in future.

Thanks in advance!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I would guess that the benefit with more classes in a build for the most part is with "front loaded" classes where you can add a level or two for some cheese or to qualify for a prestigue class that would not be possible otherwise with a given set of only 3 classes.
Many classes still benefit from a high number of levels, such as casters, rangers, AAs, assassins etc.
There is also the question of more than 40% xp penalty that now really can slow down the character progression.
It still remains to be seen how many PWs that choose to expand beyond 3 classes. If they do, we will face a new type of build requests.
I think we should start to explore the possibilities.

Download that file and extract it into your override folder (on my Windows 11 PC, go to documents/Neverwinter Nights/override).
When the file is in override, "right click" on it and select "open" (use Notepad if you have a choice).
Once it is open, go down to line 519 and change the 3 to something bigger, but less than 9 (I went to 8).
Then go to "file" and hit "save."
